result.execSummary:
The defendant Narvelle N Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered $10.00 fine plus any mandatory costs including DNA surcharge by 9-18-15. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment. Due to defendant's financial instability, Court will waive non-mandatory costs and surcharges. 

**Court will not suspend driver's license.**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Narvelle N Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Narvelle N Jones in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. tk

Defendant Narvelle N Jones in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. Case in court due to Justice Point Program violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. Court informed defendant to report to Justice Point Program on April 6, 2015. No action taken at this time. Case remains calendared for Status conference on March 18, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 37.
Justice Point Program violation report; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Narvelle N Jones not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defense counsel needs additional time to review discovery and plea negotiations.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Narvelle N Jones in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Narvelle N Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
